alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Caldwell; De Soto; Jackson; La Salle; Natchitoches; Red River; Webster; Winn (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 24 at 1:58PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Caldwell, southeastern Webster, Jackson, De Soto, Red River, north central Natchitoches, northern La Salle, southern Caddo, Bienville, southeastern Bossier, Winn Parishes in north central Louisiana and northeastern Shelby Counties through 300 PM CDT... At 158 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sherwood to 12 miles southwest of Olla to 10 miles west of Winnfield to 6 miles east of Coushatta to Mansfield to 6 miles south of Logansport. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Shreveport, Bossier City, Mansfield, Winnfield, Jonesboro, Columbia, Coushatta, Stonewall, Logansport, Ringgold, Olla, Clarks, Grayson, Heflin, Urania, Martin, Hodge, Goldonna, North Hodge and Tullos. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Bienville; Bossier; Caddo; Caldwell; De Soto; Jackson; La Salle; Natchitoches; Red River; Webster; Winn
